messages.subject: Re: japanese sword distintctions;
messages.msgSnippet: Another basic book, is the The Smaurai Sword By John Yumoto, can get it at B&N and Boarders for about 20 bucks, has alot of good info about the sword gi s
messages.messageBody:
Another basic book, is the The Smaurai Sword By John Yumoto, can get
it at B&N and Boarders for about 20 bucks, has alot of good info
about the sword gi's brought back from the war and how they where
made. A good starter book


--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "donkihote1963"
<franzkafka19@m...> wrote:
> I am interested in purchasing a book that will show me the
> differances between koto, shinto and shinshinto blades. Please
help!
> Mark. franzkafka19@m... Thank you. PS. it should be written so
> idiots can understand it :-) (my level) :-)

messages.subject: Re: japanese sword distintctions;
messages.msgSnippet: ... The Connoisseur s Book of Japanese Swords by Nakayama Kokan. Translated by Kenji Mishina. and/or The Japanese Sword by Sato I believe both are still in
messages.messageBody:
--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "donkihote1963" <franzkafka19@m
...> wrote:
> I am interested in purchasing a book that will show me the
> differances between koto, shinto and shinshinto blades. Please help!
> Mark. franzkafka19@m... Thank you. PS. it should be written so
> idiots can understand it :-) (my level) :-)

The Connoisseur's Book of Japanese Swords by Nakayama Kokan.
Translated by Kenji Mishina.

and/or

The Japanese Sword by Sato

I believe both are still in print.

Rich S

messages.subject: japanese sword distintctions;
messages.msgSnippet: I am interested in purchasing a book that will show me the differances between koto, shinto and shinshinto blades. Please help! Mark. franzkafka19@msn.com
messages.messageBody:
I am interested in purchasing a book that will show me the
differances between koto, shinto and shinshinto blades. Please help!
Mark. franzkafka19@... Thank you. PS. it should be written so
idiots can understand it :-) (my level) :-)
